text:
Hey guys, just a quick introduction: I’m Alexander Jeurissen a frontend developer / computer science student from Holland.
I work at DefactoSoftware in Groningen and the product I’m working on (<http://LearningSpaces.io|LearningSpaces.io>) is a ember + rails app.
I came across this community through a blogpost of a member about initializers in ember-cli, in this post he linked back to your slack community :wink:

I hope to find interesting articles here and to have found a nice active community where we can exchange ember knowledge.
hello there!
<@U0A9ALENN>: how do you put together Ember and Rails? All in a single app with something like ember-rails? Separate apps using ember-cli? Something else?
we are using ember-rails, But I’m currently working on migrating to ember-cli rails as a temporary solution. Eventually we’d like to have both apps separate.
point is that we want to run ember-cli asap, we’ll keep the Devise views etc. for now but eventually will  use something like ember-cli-simple auth etc.
cool. I’m a Rails dev myself, and I’d like to hear more stories about this. It’s a topic I’m not terribly comfortable with
it’s quite a hassle indeed, especially because my ember-cli migration branch is currently around 60 commits behind our main develop branch xD
gonna be fun to rebase all that
ooops!
hi <@U0A9ALENN> great to meet you
hello <@U0A9ALENN> nice to meet you
thank you all for the warm welcome :wink:
Welcome <@U0A9ALENN>

<@U0A9ALENN> / <@U05485UQL> We are incrementally migrating a rails app across to ember-cli so the users can see no difference and wouldn't have a clue if they are on a rails page or an ember page.....Happy to chat through my experiences on this subject if you like.
I may grab you tomorrow :simple_smile:
Sure thing <@U05485UQL>  :thumbsup:
<@U043AB2QT>: that’s interesting, I have read several blogs about people that did a similar migration. What your describing is also our goal with migrating to ember-cli.
we still have too many rails views / tight coupling between rails and ember and therefore it’s not doable to migrate all at once. The code base is just too large for that.

it’s the result of a rapid prototype written in rails, with some ember on top. so it’s gonna take a while to remove the coupling and the logic duplication that will eventually happen is worth the separation of concerns in the long term.

Yup. A Big Bang generally isn't the best approach. If you can take an incremental approach then you should in my opinion. I'll dig up the blog post I wrote on our setup if you're interested. It might be of use.
Sounds very much like our setup mate.
I’m definitely interested in that blog post
